issue.title: Feature request: [no-shadow] It would really help, if the error message would show where the original identifier has been defined

labels.name: awaiting response
labels.description: Issues waiting for a reply from the OP or another party

repository.name: typescript-eslint
repository.description: :sparkles: Monorepo for all the tooling which enables ESLint to support TypeScript

issue.body:
In my experience, the `no-shadow` rule could greatly benefit from an error message that also describes where the identifier has already been defined and not only where the redefinition has occurred.

```TS
const a = 1;

if (a === 1) {
	const a = 5;
	console.log(a);
}
```

Instead of the current error:

`4:8  error  'a' is already declared in the upper scope  @typescript-eslint/no-shadow`

the following would be most helpful:

 `4:8  error  'a' is already declared in the upper scope (1:7)  @typescript-eslint/no-shadow`

**Versions**

| package                            | version |
| ---------------------------------- | ------- |
| `@typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin` | `4.0.1` |
| `@typescript-eslint/parser`        | `4.0.1` |
| `TypeScript`                       | `4.0.2` |
| `ESLint`                           | `7.8.0` |
| `node`                             | `14.8.0` |

body:
Thanks for the issue


Make sense to me.
Makes sense to me, too. I'll champion this.

I have worked on this issue.
I will open pull request, if you like, please check and review my codes.
